item.title: Approximation by zero-free continuous maps
item.description: arXiv:2508.05931v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that a continuous R^n-valued map on a subset E of R^n that is zero-free on the interior of E is a uniform limit of continuous R^n-valued maps that are zero-free on all of E.
item.dc:creator: Alexander J. Izzo

item.title: Regularity Conditions for Critical Point Convergence
item.description: arXiv:2507.01854v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We focus on a sequence of functions $\{f_n\}$, defined on a compact manifold with boundary $S$, converging in the $C^k$ metric to a limit $f$. A common assumption implicitly made in the empirical sciences is that when such functions represent random processes derived from data, the topological features of $f_n$ will eventually resemble those of $f$. In this work, we investigate the validity of this claim under various regularity assumptions, with the goal of finding conditions sufficient for the number of local maxima, minima and saddle of such functions to converge. In the $C^1$ setting, we do so by employing lesser-known variants of the Poincar\'{e}-Hopf and mountain pass theorems, and in the $C^2$ setting we pursue an approach inspired by the homotopy-based proof of the Morse Lemma. To aid practical use, we end by reformulating our central theorems in the language of the empirical processes.
item.dc:creator: Thomas J. Maullin-Sapey, Samuel Davenport
